column5: PM me if you suffer from leg cramps. You won't beleive how easy it is. (and no, this isn't one a granny's doctorin' practises)
Is it water? It's water, right   I used to get them bad after a day on the lake or in the bush. I thaught I remember reading they would be more frequent and worse if you were dehydrated.
Why not just save the time and post your cure Dr Quinn?
The answer is bizarre...but subsequent web searches has testimonials from lots of people who swear by it...thanks for posting this thread Clampet...I'm going to give it a try!
This would be the 'bar o soap in the bed' cure?

I saw the soap thing on snopes.com (it was inconclusive), but they talked about leg cramps in the calves.  When I get them they're always in the thigh. I can put my hand against the leg and literally feel the muscle go nuts. Not fun. Only happens after a day of fun (ice fishing, hunting) and after I've rested a while.
Does it involve a broomstick and a goat?
Jed, no leg cramps for me, but you're right, I'm a heck of a googler.
ohhh jeeeze Roy ... ya gotta lay a little warning out in front of those ones fella .... now I gotta go change
Joe would have the answer to at least one of those options,

Oh I hate leg cramps. When the temps get down to -15 out there and below the veins back of my knee tightens up and boy does that hurt. I usually have to stop everything and masage it.   But since I wear thermals thats not a problem anymore.   dsn
i don't get leg cramps but i get nasty ones under my feet that pretty much cripple me for at least 30 seconds,  would ur trick help me ??????
PM me and I'll share with you.
